The Proof Obligation Explorer (Rodin User Manual)

Dear reader, some formulas and templates are not yet rendered well, but the problem is being worked out...

{{ #if: Saving a Context or a Machine | Previous:Saving a Context or a Machine | }} {{ #if: The Proving Perspective | Next:The Proving Perspective | }} {{ #if: User_Manual_index | Up:User_Manual_index | }}


The "Proof Obligation Explorer" window has the same main entries as the "Project Explorer" window, namely the projects and its components (context and machines). When expanding a component in the Proof Obligation Explorer you get a list of its proof obligations as generated automatically by the Proof Obligation Generator:

As can be seen in this screen shot, machine "celebrity_1" of project "celebrity" is expanded. We find seven proof obligations. Each of them has got a compound name as indicated in the tables below. A green logo situated on the left of the proof obligation name states that it has been proved (an A means it has been proved automatically). By clicking on the proof obligation name, you are transferred into the Proving Perspective which we are going to describe in subsequent sections.

Next is a table describing the names of context proof obligations:

<math> \begin{array}{|l|l|l|}\; \; \; \hbox{Well-definedness of an Axiom} \; \; & \; \; \hbox{$axm$\ \ /\ WD} \; \; & \; \; \hbox{$axm$ is the axiom name} \; \; \\ \; \; \; \hbox{Well-definedness of a Theorem} \; \; & \; \; \hbox{$thm$\ \ /\ WD} \; \; & \; \; \hbox{$thm$ is the theorem name} \; \; \\ \; \; \; \hbox{Theorem} \; \; & \; \; \hbox{$thm$\ \ /\ THM} \; \; & \; \; \hbox{$thm$ is the theorem name} \; \; \\ \end{array} </math>

Next is a table showing the name of machine proof obligations:

<math> \begin{array}{|l|l|l|}\; \; \; \hbox{Well-definedness of an Invariant} \; \; & \; \; \hbox{$inv$\ \ /\ WD} \; \; & \; \; \hbox{$inv$ is the invariant name} \; \; \\ \; \; \; \hbox{Well-definedness of a Theorem} \; \; & \; \; \hbox{$thm$\ \ /\ WD} \; \; & \; \; \hbox{$thm$ is the theorem name} \; \; \\ \; \; \; \hbox{Well-definedness of an event Guard} \; \; & \; \; \hbox{$evt$\ \ /\ $grd$ \ / WD} \; \; & \; \; \begin{array}{l} \hbox{$evt$ is the event name} \\ \hbox{$grd$ is the action name} \end{array}\; \; \\ \; \; \; \hbox{Well-definedness of an event Action} \; \; & \; \; \hbox{$evt$\ \ /\ $act$ \ / WD} \; \; & \; \; \begin{array}{l} \hbox{$evt$ is the event name} \\ \hbox{$act$ is the action name} \end{array}\; \; \\ \; \; \; \hbox{Feasibility of a non-det. event Action} \; \; & \; \; \hbox{$evt$\ \ /\ $act$ \ / FIS} \; \; & \; \; \begin{array}{l} \hbox{$evt$ is the event name} \\ \hbox{$act$ is the action name} \end{array}\; \; \\ \; \; \; \hbox{Theorem} \; \; & \; \; \hbox{$thm$\ \ /\ THM} \; \; & \; \; \hbox{$thm$ is the theorem name} \; \; \\ \; \; \; \hbox{Invariant Establishment} \; \; & \; \; \hbox{INIT. \ / $inv$\ \ /\ INV} \; \; & \; \; \hbox{$inv$ is the invariant name} \; \; \\ \; \; \; \hbox{Invariant Preservation} \; \; & \; \; \hbox{$evt$ \ / $inv$\ \ /\ INV} \; \; & \; \; \begin{array}{l} \hbox{$evt$ is the event name} \\ \hbox{$inv$ is the invariant name} \end{array} \; \; \\ \end{array} </math>

Next are the proof obligations concerned with machine refinements: <math> \begin{array}{|l|l|l|}\; \; \; \hbox{Guard Strengthening} \; \; & \; \; \hbox{$evt$\ \ /\ $grd$ \ /\ GRD} \; \; & \; \; \begin{array}{l} \hbox{$evt$ is the concrete event name} \\ \hbox{$grd$ is the abstract guard name} \end{array}\; \; \\ \; \; \; \hbox{Guard Strengthening (merge)} \; \; & \; \; \hbox{$evt$\ \ /\ MRG} \; \; & \; \; \hbox{$evt$ is the concrete event name} \; \; \\ \; \; \; \hbox{Action Simulation} \; \; & \; \; \hbox{$evt$\ \ /\ $act$ \ /\ SIM} \; \; & \; \; \begin{array}{l} \hbox{$evt$ is the concrete event name} \\ \hbox{$act$ is the abstract action name} \end{array} \; \; \\ \; \; \; \hbox{Equality of a preserved Variable} \; \; & \; \; \hbox{$evt$\ \ /\ $v$ \ /\ EQL} \; \; & \; \; \begin{array}{l} \hbox{$evt$ is the concrete event name} \\ \hbox{$v$ is the preserved variable} \end{array} \; \; \\ \end{array} </math>

Next are the proof obligations concerned with the new events variant:

<math> \begin{array}{|l|l|l|}\; \; \; \hbox{Well definedness of Variant} \; \; & \; \; \hbox{VWD} \; \; & \; \; \\ \; \; \; \hbox{Finiteness for a set Variant} \; \; & \; \; \hbox{FIN} \; \; & \; \; \\ \; \; \; \hbox{Natural number for a numeric Variant} \; \; & \; \; \hbox{$evt$\ \ /\ NAT} \; \; & \; \; \hbox{$evt$ is the new event name} \; \; \\ \; \; \; \hbox{Decreasing of Variant} \; \; & \; \; \hbox{$evt$\ \ /\ VAR} \; \; & \; \; \hbox{$evt$ is the new event name} \; \; \\ \end{array} </math> Finally, here are the proof obligations concerned with witnesses:

<math>\begin{array}{|l|l|l|}\; \; \; \hbox{Well definedness of Witness} \; \; & \; \; \hbox{$evt$\ \ /\ $p$ \ /\ WWD} \; \; & \; \; \begin{array}{l} \hbox{$evt$ is the concrete event name} \\ \hbox{$p$ is parameter name} \\ \hbox{or a primed variable name} \end{array}\; \; \\ \; \; \; \hbox{Feasibility of non-det. Witness} \; \; & \; \; \hbox{$evt$\ \ /\ $p$ \ /\ WFIS} \; \; & \; \; \begin{array}{l} \hbox{$evt$ is the concrete event name} \\ \hbox{$p$ is parameter name} \\ \hbox{or a primed variable name} \end{array}\; \; \\ \end{array} </math>

Remark: At the moment, the deadlock freeness proof obligation generation is missing. If you need it, you can generate it yourself as a theorem saying the the disjunction of the abstract guards imply the disjunction of the concrete guards.

Dear reader, some formulas and templates are not yet rendered well, but the problem is being worked out...
